objects.description:
Prerequisite: 
1. A valid foreign SIM card with data plan is in the phone

User Story:
MTR-23264 
When a setting is changed to ‘connect automatically’ a warning is presented; example warning: “You changed to ‘connect automatically’. Be aware that data charges might apply! You like to continue? Yes/No”

User Story Reference: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9ygfskg9dlfsb2q/Roaming%20UI_Feb%2004.pdf

This is MTR-23264 part A.
objects.name: [Roaming Charge] The warning comes out when automatical connection enabled

steps.expected:
You should see you carrier's name under the page title "Cellular & Data".
Also, category "Data" with "Data connection" and "Data Roaming" shown. And, "Network operator", "Data settings", and "A-GPS settings" under "Advanced settings" category.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings" app > Go to "Cellular & Data" section

steps.expected: A popup come out with a warning and two buttons - "Cancel" & "Turn On"
It went back to "Cellular & Data" settings menu. "Data connection" has a subtitle warning under it. Data roaming should be disabled at this time.
The "browser" app shows up
It shouldn't connect to the website since data roaming is not on
steps.instruction: Enter any valid website address to the url bar (eg. http://www.google.com/ or http://www.yahoo.com)

objects.description:
Prerequisite:

User Story:
MTR-23264 
When a setting is changed to ‘connect automatically’ a warning is presented; example warning: “You changed to ‘connect automatically’. Be aware that data charges might apply! You like to continue? Yes/No”

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
1. A valid foreign SIM card with data plan in the phone

MTR-27675	(SW ENablers, General UI):
There shall be a global dataconnection switch in the UI. Users shall be prompted before the first data connection is established and warned about additional costs depending on their data plan.

User Story Reference: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9ygfskg9dlfsb2q/Roaming%20UI_Feb%2004.pdf
objects.name: [Roaming Charge] Option to enabled cellular data in FTE

steps.expected: When you turn on the cell phone, FTE comes out.
steps.instruction: Flash your cell phone so that it starts with FTE.

steps.expected: You will see "Enable Data" switch
steps.instruction: Click "Next" all the way till the title is "Cellular Data"

steps.expected: See a warning below the switch about charges and other related notice on the same screen
you will see home screen
steps.instruction: Click "next" all the way till you see "skip", and click "skip"

steps.expected: "Browser" app shows up
The website should not show up since there is no roaming enabled.
steps.instruction: enter any valid url in url bar (eg. http://www.google.com/ or http://www.yahoo.com/)

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
1. A valid foreign SIM card with data plan is in the phone
2. Make sure that you flashed your cell phone so that it would be 1st time for you to allowed 3G downloading of patches.
3. Close Wifi connection ("Settings" > "Wi-fi" > turn wifi off) and turn on 3G connection ("Settings" > "Cellular & Data" > turn "data connection" and "data roaming" on)

MTR-29340	(Software Updates)
In case the customer chooses theCellular Network for download of updates then the customer is presented with the charging advice unless the OEM Service is zero-rated by a local DT Affiliate in which case the charging advice shall not appear for the respective local variant

User Story Reference: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9ygfskg9dlfsb2q/Roaming%20UI_Feb%2004.pdf
objects.name: [Roaming Charge] Prompt shows up when 1st time allowed downloading of updates by 3G

steps.expected: Shows "n updates available" and n updates below. Also, checkboxes are on the right of the updates
steps.instruction: When the update available, there comes the notification

steps.expected: A prompt shows up and telling you about the important notice about charges and other info.
It should be downloaded

objects.description:

On the screen, there should be a warning that additional charges may apply.
It should be downloaded

objects.description:
Prerequisite:

objects.description:
As a user when there is audio content on a web page, I will be able to hear the audio content and adjust the volume using the volume up/down rocker.

Prerequisites:  any page that has streaming audio or video content (for example:  www.soundclick.com, www.last.fm for audio, freeplaymusic.com ; www.youtube.com for video)
objects.name: [User Sound] adjusting web content volume with volume rocker

steps.expected: Volume goes up for the streamed sample.   Volume indicator on screen reflects volume level.
steps.instruction: Surf  to a site and play a streaming audio sample.  While playing, adjust volume up on volume rocker.

steps.expected: Volume goes all the way down, and eventually is muted.  Volume indicator on screen reflects volume level.
steps.instruction: On the same audio sample, while playing, turn the volume all the way down using volume rocker.

steps.expected: Volume goes up for the streamed sample.   Volume indicator on screen reflects volume level.
steps.instruction: Surf e.g. to YouTube and play a streaming video.  While playing, turn the volume all the way up using volume rocker.

steps.expected: Volume goes all the way down, and eventually is muted.  Volume indicator on screen reflects volume level.
steps.instruction: On the video sample, while its playing, turn the volume all the way down using the volume rocker.

objects.description:
As a user when I finish my phone call, the audio from the FM Radio app must resume if it was active before the call.

Resume playing FM Radio after a call comes in; resume playing FM radio after ending a call initiated from the phone.
objects.name: [User Sound] Verify ending phone calls with FM Radio in background works correctly

steps.expected: The FM Radio resumes playing once the call is ended.
steps.instruction: Launch the FM Radio.  While it is playing, call into the FFOS phone from a second phone.   Let it go for a few seconds and then terminate the call from the FFOS phone.

steps.expected: The FM Radio resumes playing once the call is ended.
steps.instruction: While the radio is playing, call into the FFOS phone from a second phone.   Let it go for a few seconds and then terminate the call from the remote phone.

steps.expected: The FM Radio resumes playing once the call is ended.
steps.instruction: While the radio is playing, call out from the FFOS phone to a second phone.   Let it go for a few seconds and then terminate the call from the FFOS phone.

steps.expected: The FM Radio resumes playing once the call is ended.
steps.instruction: While the radio is playing, call out from the FFOS phone to a second phone.   Let it go for a few seconds and then terminate the call from the remote phone.

steps.expected: Verify the volume for FM Radio in headphones should decrease as well as the visual indicator on the screen shows decrease accordingly.

objects.description: Users will be able to call and interact with conference lines. Only one of the numbers needs to be called.
objects.name: [Dialer] Verify that touch tones work using Mozilla's conference line.

steps.expected:
a)Verify that you are able to connect to the Mozilla conference line. (Note: If another party is not dialed in at the same time, you will hear hold music until someone joins. If silence is heard, that that is also ok.)
b) Verify that you get connected to the Mozilla conference line or hear hold music if someone is not dialed into the call. If silence is heard then that is also ok.
steps.instruction:
One of the following processes must be completed:
a) If you are local to either  1 650 903 0800 or 1 416 848 3114; dial it and then type in extension 92 and conference line 98500
b) If you are international or not local to the numbers above, dial  1 800 707 2533. Enter  pin 369 and  conference line 98500, when prompted  (toll free, Skype).

objects.description: User sees the system crash message once the device "reboots" after a crash. The prompt is displayed only when the first crash is a system crash.
objects.name: [Crash Reporting] System Crash Reporting Prompt - First time OS crash

steps.instruction:
Type into Cygwin while device is plugged in: 
adb shell ps

Generate a Firefox OS crash by killing the active B2G process using ADB.

Example:
1. Run command ""adb shell b2g-ps""
2. Run command ""adb shell kill -11 [PID for B2G from step 1]

steps.expected: What's in a Crash Report? Link should be selectable and should lead to a page which describes more about what a crash report contains.
steps.instruction: Review crash report dialog - What's in a Crash Report? link

steps.expected: "Send Report" in active and can be pressed to submit the report.
steps.instruction: Review "Send Report" button at bottom of screen

steps.expected: "Always" send Mozilla a report when a crash occurs is checked by default.
steps.instruction: Review checkbox preference at bottom of screen

steps.expected: "'Don't send' is always inactive when the 'Always send' checkbox is checked"
steps.instruction: Review "Don't Send " button at bottom of screen

objects.description:
User sees the app crash message once the device "reboots" after a crash. The prompt is displayed only when the first crash is an app crash.

Prerequisites:  Make sure Settngs => Improve Firefox OS => Crash reports is set to "Ask me when a crash occurs."
objects.name: [Crash Reporting] App Crash Reporting Prompt - First time app crash

steps.expected: This should give you a list of processes on your device.
steps.instruction:
Type into Cygwin: 
adb shell ps

Generate a Firefox app crash by killing the active app process using ADB.

Example:
app_0     409   109   55512  16760 ffffffff 40064330 S /system/b2g/plugin-container
> adb shell kill -11 409

steps.expected: What's in a Crash Report? Link should be selectable and should lead to a page which describes more about what a crash report contains.
steps.instruction: Review crash report dialog - What's in a Crash Report? link

steps.expected: "Send Report" in active and can be pressed to submit the report.
steps.instruction: Review "Send Report" button at bottom of screen

steps.expected: "Always" send Mozilla a report when a crash occurs is checked by default.
steps.instruction: Review checkbox preference at bottom of screen

steps.expected: "'Don't send' is always inactive when the 'Always send' checkbox is checked"
steps.instruction: Review "Don't Send " button at bottom of screen

objects.description: Show this banner if the user wants to be asked before sending a report each time a crash occurs. This is the state if the user doesn't select "Always send report"
objects.name: [Crash Reporting] Report Banner (Subsequent crashes, send state is "ask each time")

steps.expected: This should give you a list of processes on your device.
steps.instruction:
Type into Cygwin: 
adb shell ps |grep b2g

Make sure you are connected to Wifi. Generate a Firefox OS crash by killing the active B2G process using ADB.

Example:
*root      109   1     191120 66024 ffffffff 400fa330 S /system/b2g/b2g
*> adb shell kill -11 109

steps.expected: The crash report is submitted.
steps.instruction: Press the send button to submit the crash report.

steps.expected: Pref should be turned on.
steps.instruction: Go into Settings | Improve Firefox OS | Crash Reports and check the pref that says "Ask when a crash occurs"

steps.expected: Another crash is generated. This time you should receive a screen that looks like Page 6 with a Banner at the bottom of the page.
steps.instruction: Repeat Step #2 if it is the first time you have crashed on the phone.

steps.expected: The crash report is submitted.
steps.instruction: Press the "Report" button to submit the report.

steps.expected:
You will see a report in the format:
Example: Crash ID: bp-1c5af444-9f23-4674-b8ee-871f02130108
steps.instruction:
Confirm crash report submission by navigating to:

Confirm the report has been submitted by navigating to the following directory on the phone using DDMS File Explorer  - this requires that you be connected to the device:

Data | B2G  | Mozilla | Crash Report s| Submitted

DDMS allows you to copy and paste the report to your computer.

objects.description: Show this banner if the user has chosen to either always send a crash report, or to never send a crash report.
objects.name: [Crash Reporting] Crash Banner (Subsequent crashes, send state is "always")

steps.expected: This should give you a list of processes on your device.
steps.instruction:
Type into Cygwin: 
*adb shell ps |grep b2g

Make sure you are connected to Wifi. Generate a Firefox OS crash by killing the active B2G process using ADB.

Example:
*root      109   1     191120 66024 ffffffff 400fa330 S /system/b2g/b2g
*> adb shell kill -11 109

steps.expected: The crash report is submitted.
steps.instruction: Press the send button to submit the crash report.

steps.expected: Pref should be turned on.
steps.instruction: Go into Settings | Improve Firefox OS | Crash Reports and check the pref that says "Never send a report."

steps.expected: Another crash is generated. This time you should receive a screen that looks like Page 7 with a Banner at the bottom of the page.
steps.instruction: Repeat Step #2 if it is the first time you have crashed on the phone.

steps.expected: Confirm that the banner is Informational only, with no action required on the part of the user.  Banner disappears automatically.

objects.description: Per spec, crash reports currently are sent over WiFi only and not over data.
objects.name: [Crash Reporting] Data connection: Confirm Crash Report submission

steps.expected: Confirm data onnection by loading a web page.
steps.instruction: Enable data on the device. Confirm wifi is turned off.

steps.expected: Confirm you get the dialog show on Page 4 of http://people.mozilla.com/~lco/Crash_Reporting_B2G/R1_Crash%20Reports%20v1.pdf.
steps.instruction:
Generate a B2G OS System Crash by using this sample command:

*  adb shell ps |grep b2g
*  root      109   1     191120 66024 ffffffff 400fa330 S /system/b2g/b2g
*  > adb shell kill -11 109

steps.expected: The report is not sent to Mozilla.
steps.instruction: Press the send button to send the report.

steps.expected:
You should not see a report in the format:
Example: Crash ID: bp-1c5af444-9f23-4674-b8ee-871f02130108

To get more information about the stack, cut and paste the crash report ID into the search field here: https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/
steps.instruction:
Confirm the report has not been submitted by navigating to the following directory on the phone through Cygwin.

adb shell (enter)
cd data (enter)
cd b2g (enter)
cd mozilla (enter)
cd "Crash Reports" (enter)
cd submitted (enter)
ls -al (enter)

objects.description:
Verify that Files on the USB mass storage are able to be deleted from the device through Mac Finder or File System.


Prerequisites:
----
#-Macintosh Desktop/Laptop
#-Have at least 1 Video, 1 Image, and 1 Music file in the Media Storage
objects.name: Verify that Files can be deleted from the USB Mass Storage (Macintosh)

steps.instruction: Plug the Device into the Mac Desktop/Laptop.
From the Homescreen navigate to Settings>Media storage>USB mass storage.

steps.expected: Device is detected by the Mac Desktop/Laptop and appears in finder/file manager.
steps.instruction: Toggle the USB Mass Storage option to enabled.
Using the Mac finder/file manager, navigate to the DCIM Directory on the USB storage.
Locate the Video, Image, and Music files in the DCIM folder.

steps.expected: All files are removed, and no longer appear on the device.
steps.instruction: Delete all the files located in (Step 5) using the Mac finder/file manager.

2. go through FTE

4. finish the FTE
5. go to settings -> Improve Firefox OS

1) a banner should appear at the bottom stating what has crashed 
2) there should be a "Report" button on the banner

1. go to settings -> Improve Firefox OS
2. set to "Ask me when a crash occurs"
3. kill -11 an app (plugin/container) or b2g process

1. banner should appear saying that the app/os crashed
2. there should be no report button on the banner.

1. go to settings 
2. go to Improve Firefox OS 
3. select "Always send a report"
4. crash either b2g or the app by using kill -11 <process id>

objects.description:
Purpose of the test is to verify that the crash is placed in pending:
1) no wifi no mobile data
2) airplane mode
3) no wifi; mobile data

After each of the set of steps do a "Reset Phone" in Device Information - More Information, to make sure the crash report comes up again.
objects.name: [Crash Reporting] Turn wifi off:  crash reports should be in pending

steps.expected: verify that the crash report is in pending; via going to /data/b2g/mozilla/Crash Reports/pending
steps.instruction:
1. go to settings
2. turn wifi off
3. turn data connection off
4. launch an app
5. adb shell b2g-ps
6. kill the app with (adb shell kill -11 <process id>)

steps.expected: verify that the crash report is in pending folder; via going to /data/b2g/mozilla/Crash Reports/pending
steps.instruction:
1. go to settings
2. turn wifi on
3. turn data connection off
4. turn airplane mode on
5. launch an app
6. adb shell b2g-ps
7. kill the app with (adb shell kill -11 <process id>)

steps.expected: verify that the crash report is in pending folder; via going to /data/b2g/mozilla/Crash Reports/pending
steps.instruction:
1. go to settings
2. turn wifi off
3. turn data connection on
4. turn airplane mode off
5. launch an app
6. adb shell b2g-ps
7. kill the app with (adb shell kill -11 <process id>)

objects.description:
Prerequisite: 
1.Please do not test this before you tested Test Case 5924&5923
2.Make sure the Wifi is off ("Settings" > "Wi-fi" > See that wifi is not on)
3.A valid foreign SIM card with data plan is in the phone

User Story: MTR-23264 When a setting is changed to ‘connect automatically’ a warning is presented; example warning: “You changed to ‘connect automatically’. Be aware that data charges might apply! You like to continue? Yes/No”

User Story Reference: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9ygfskg9dlfsb2q/Roaming%20UI_Feb%2004.pdf
This is MTR-23264 part B
objects.name: [Roaming Charge] The warning comes out when automatical roaming enabled and can be cancelled

steps.expected: You should see you carrier's name under the page title "Cellular & Data". Also, category "Data" with "Data connection" and "Data Roaming" shown. And, "Network operator", "Data settings", and "A-GPS settings" under "Advanced settings" category.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings" app > Go in "Cellular & Data" section

steps.expected: Data connection is on.
A popup come out with a warning and two buttons - "Cancel" & "Turn On"
It went back to "Cellular & Data" settings menu. "Data Roaming" didn't get enabled
The "Browser" app shows up
The website should not show up due to not opening of data roaming
steps.instruction: Enter any valid website in url bar (eg. http://www.google.com/ or http://www.yahoo.com)

objects.description:
Prerequisite: a valid foreign SIM card with data plan is in the phone

MTR-29340	(Software Updates)
In case the customer chooses the Cellular Network for download of updates then the customer is presented with the charging advice unless the OEM Service is zero-rated by a local DT Affiliate in which case the charging advice shall not appear for the respective local variant

User Story Reference: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9ygfskg9dlfsb2q/Roaming%20UI_Feb%2004.pdf
objects.name: [Roaming Charge] When not connecting to any kind of internet, the update notification should ask to update late.

steps.expected: FTE is navigated with no errors and the homescreen appears
steps.instruction: Flash the device and navigate through the FTE, making sure not to enable data connection or WiFi

steps.expected: The Cellular & Data page loads
The switches next to both settings show blue fields with checkmarks, indicating that they are active
steps.instruction: Turn on both Data Connection and Data Roaming

steps.expected: A "1 update available" notification appears
The switches next to both settings show blank white, indicating that they are inactive
steps.instruction: Disable both Data Connection and Data Roaming

steps.expected: "1 update available" is visible in the notification area
steps.instruction: Pull down the status bar and look for the update notification

steps.expected: The update contents are shown with a Later button and the message "Connection unavailable.  Connect to a network to download updates."
User is returned to the homescreen

objects.description:
As a user, when in coverage of a known open WiFi network which uses a captive portal for login authentication, I want to be presented with a notification. When I open the browser, it should display a login user interface to enter my credentials/payment to gain network access.

Prerequisite: 
1. Prepare an open WiFi with captive portal for login authentication. 
2. Take the phone into the coverage of WiFi. 
3. Flash the phone, or forget all WiFi network
objects.name: [WiFi] [Captive Portal] Login the known captive portal WiFi by browser.

steps.expected: Wi-Fi can be enable, and you can see the name of captive portal Wi-Fi in Available networks list.
steps.instruction: open the Settings app, enable Wi-Fi.
click the captive portal Wi-Fi, and disable Wi-Fi.

steps.expected: Wi-Fi can be enable. The phone can show Homescreen and connect to the captive portal Wi-Fi.
steps.instruction: enable Wi-Fi, then press Home button.

steps.expected: The notification "The network XXX was found. Join network?" should be presented.
the Browser app is launched and browser should be redirected to the login page.
the Browser should show the login success page.
the website http://www.google.com/ can display in Browser.

objects.description:
As a user, after manually connecting to an open WiFi network which uses a captive portal for login authentication, I want to be presented with a login user interface, allowing me to enter my credentials/payment to gain network access.

Prerequisite: 
1. Prepare an open WiFi with captive portal for login authentication. 
2. Take the phone into the coverage of WiFi. 
3. Flash the phone, or forget all WiFi network
objects.name: [WiFi] [Captive Portal] Redirect to the login page of captive portal WiFi.

steps.expected: Wi-Fi can be enable, and you can see the name of captive portal Wi-Fi in Available networks list.
steps.instruction: open the Settings app, enable Wi-Fi.

steps.expected: the Browser should be redirected to the login page.
the Browser should show the login success page.
the website http://www.google.com/ can display in Browser.

objects.description:

Double Tap the Caps Lock key (⇧)

steps.expected: Special Characters [Á|ª|À|Â|Ä|Å|Ã|Ā|Æ] are entered and displayed correctly
steps.instruction: Hold the "A" key then highlight and release it on each special character

steps.expected: Portuguese Language keyboard is displayed
steps.instruction: Press the Keyboard Language Layout button
Double Tap the Caps Lock key (⇧)

steps.expected: Special Characters [Á|Ã|À|Â|Ä|Å|Æ|ª] are entered and displayed correctly
steps.instruction: Hold the "A" key then highlight and release it on each special character

Verify the correct Character is entered when tapping the corresponding Character Key.

#Pre-Requisites:
#In the Settings>Keyboard menu toggle English, Spanish, & Portuguese ON

steps.instruction: Select the Create New Message Icon

steps.expected: Text Input Keyboard is displayed
Numbers and Special Characters keyboard is displayed
Character “$” is written
The Spanish language Keyboard is displayed

Character “:” is written
The Portuguese language Keyboard is displayed
steps.instruction: Press the Keyboard Language Layout button

steps.expected: Numbers and Special Characters keyboard is displayed
Character “:” is written

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

objects.description:
When an uppercase key (that has special characters) is held down on the Text Input Keyboard, a window appears with special characters and a default character highlighted. That highlighted character is chosen if the user then releases the key.
#Pre-Requisites: 
#In the Settings>Keyboard menu toggle English, Spanish, & Portuguese ON
objects.name: Verify the special character(s) for the "R" key [Text Input Keyboard]

steps.instruction: Select the Create New Message icon

steps.expected: Text Input Keyboard is displayed
Special Character [R$] is not displayed.
steps.instruction: Press and Hold the “R” key until the special character appears

steps.expected: Special Character [R$] is not written.
Spanish Language keyboard is chosen
steps.instruction: Press the Keyboard Language Layout button

steps.expected: Special Character [R$] is not displayed.
steps.instruction: Press and Hold the “R” key until the special characters appear

steps.expected: Special Character [R$] is not written.
Portuguese Language keyboard is chosen
steps.instruction: Press the Keyboard Language Layout button

steps.expected: Special Character [R$] are displayed
steps.instruction: Press and Hold the “R” key until the special characters appear

steps.expected: Special Character [R$] is written

objects.description:

#Prequisites:  There are video files available on the device.

objects.name: [Bluetooth]  Receiving video files via bluetooth, but denying transfer

steps.instruction: Send a file from the target device. When prompted "accept bluetooth file transfer", deny (click "deny").

steps.expected: The video file that was denied transfer should not exist on the device.
steps.instruction: Check the gallery, video player and file system for the video file you just transferred.

objects.description:
As a user, from the Video application, I want to be able to send video files to another mobile device or computer using Bluetooth to make it easier to share content.

Prerequisites:  There are video files available on the device. 
Bluetooth is enabled on both phone and target device.
Phone and target device are paired.  
Video player is launched.

NOTE:  These steps may change!
objects.name: Verify the user can send video files via bluetooth

steps.instruction: In the phone's video player, or from the gallery, select a video file.
Click option(...) button, and press 'Share' button
Choose the device to which you want to transfer the files.
Accept the file transfer on the target device.

steps.expected: The files exist on the target device.
steps.instruction: Verify the presence of the file on the target device.

objects.description:
As a user, from the Video application, I want to be able to send video files to another mobile device or computer using Bluetooth to make it easier to share content.

Prerequisites: There are video files available on the device. Bluetooth is enabled on both phone and target device. Phone and target device are paired.
Video player is launched.

NOTE: These steps may change!
objects.name: Verify sending video files via Bluetooth, but cancelling on the phone before sending, works properly.

steps.instruction: In the phone's video player, or from the gallery, select a video file.
Choose the device to which you want to transfer the files.
On the phone sending the file, pull down the notification bar and tap on the "Sending file" notification.

steps.expected: Prompts and dialogs were presented as in the instructions. The file did not get sent to the target device.

steps.instruction: Verify that the file did not get sent to the target device.

objects.description:
As a user, from the Video application, I want to be able to send video files to another mobile device or computer using Bluetooth to make it easier to share content.

Prerequisites: There are video files available on the device. Bluetooth is enabled on both phone and target device. Phone and target device are paired.
Video player is launched.

NOTE: These steps may change!
objects.name: Verify sending video files via Bluetooth, but rejecting incoming file transfer on the target device, works properly.

steps.instruction: In the phone's video player, or from the gallery, select a video file.
Choose the device to which you want to transfer the files.
Reject the file transfer on the target device.

steps.expected: The dialogs and prompts are presented as per the instruction steps.   The file did not get sent to the target device, and file transfer terminates gracefully on the phone.
steps.instruction: Verify that the file did not get sent to the target device.

objects.description:
Messages-018
As a user, I can configure how my terminal downloads MMS content while roaming to help control the data charges I incur. The options I should have should include "automatic" (no prompting), "manual" (with prompting), and "never".

Confirm the settings of message can be enabled/disabled
objects.name: Message settings => Auto Retrieve = Off

steps.expected: Transfer to message settings page
Option can be adjusted and UI worked as well
steps.instruction: Under Message Settings => Auto Retrieve, toggle the setting OFF

steps.expected: Notification received successfully, but image is not downloaded yet
steps.instruction: Send a message from another phone to the test phone that has an attached image.

steps.expected: Image is not downloaded so that target image doesn't exist in gallery

objects.description:
When the user finishes the FTU/ FTE setup the user will be taken to the home screen. If the user presses the home button, then the user will be brought back to the Home screen.

Prerequisite:
Reflash the device
objects.name: [HOMESCREEN] Verify the homescreen is shown - Unlock Device and Home button

steps.expected: The user will be brought to the home screen which is displayed as expected.
The user will be brought to the home screen.
The device will be locked and the screen will be black.

steps.expected: The user will be brought to the home screen.
